To be a "yes, sir" paper, to print only news which
ostensibly benefits the University and to turn our backs
on that which we know to be wrong is to become a public

and to fail to represent student opinion to the administration.
The -News-Letter has been and will continue to be
a vehicle for the expression of student ideas which seek
acceptance at the purchasing counter of public opinion.
But being a vehicle implies more than the expression of
editorial opinion; it implies also the obligation to publish
in articles and letters views of citizens of the community
who wish to have their ideas accepted.

Such are the recollections of
a person experiencing the phenomenon of hypnosis for the
first time. He had taken a skeptical approach to hypnotism for
he "knew" it was not possible.
